fields.name: Hot Water
fields.content: Many of us don't realize that using water uses energy. In fact, supplying your home with hot water uses a lot of energy. Your hot water tank has to keep around 80 gallons of water at more than 100Â°F all day long. Hot water accounts for about 15-20% of the average householdâ€™s energy bill. By becoming more aware of your hot water use, and installing a few low-cost upgrades, you can easily reduce this number. The following steps will help you be more mindful and use your hot water more efficiently.

fields.name: Electricity
fields.content: Powering your lights and electronic devices accounts for about 16% of your home energy use.

fields.name: Home Inspections
fields.content: Having a home inspection will improve your home's re-sale value, lower your utility bills, and upgrade your home's performance. Homeowners who retrofit their homes regularly see energy savings of more than 20%, with some achieving savings of 40% or more.
